carousel_items: Don't take this with aspirin without talking to your doctor or pharmacist first.
Can make you tired and drowsy the first few days, so be careful driving or doing anything that requires concentration.
If you're using Acetazolamide for mountain sickness, make sure to go up in altitude very slowly.
Take Acetazolamide in the morning since you may urinate a lot the first few days.
Can cause numbness and tingling, temporary changes in hearing, changes in appetite, nausea, and diarrhea.

basics.benefits_moa: Acetazolamide is a diuretic that treats edema, glaucoma, seizures, and mountain sickness. It lowers the amount of fluid in the eye, reduces swelling in the legs, and allows the body to use oxygen better at high altitudes.
basics.bottom_line: Acetazolamide is used to treat and prevent mountain sickness, as well as to lower the amount of fluid in the eye and legs.
downsides: If you're using it for swelling of the legs, it's not as good as other water pills, like hydrochlorothiazide (HCTZ).
If you're using Acetazolamide for mountain sickness, try not stay at high altitudes for too long.

downsides_processed.orig: If you're using it for swelling of the legs, it's not as good as other water pills, like hydrochlorothiazide (HCTZ).
If you're using Acetazolamide for mountain sickness, try not stay at high altitudes for too long.

upsides: Considered as a first choice treatment for mountain sickness.
Most people don't have many side effects, except for more frequent urination.
Available as a generic medication, so it should be reasonably priced.

upsides_processed.orig: Considered as a first choice treatment for mountain sickness.
Most people don't have many side effects, except for more frequent urination.
Available as a generic medication, so it should be reasonably priced.

drugs.name: Acetazolamide

carousel_items_processed.orig: Don't take this with aspirin without talking to your doctor or pharmacist first.
Can make you tired and drowsy the first few days, so be careful driving or doing anything that requires concentration.
If you're using Acetazolamide for mountain sickness, make sure to go up in altitude very slowly.
Take Acetazolamide in the morning since you may urinate a lot the first few days.
Can cause numbness and tingling, temporary changes in hearing, changes in appetite, nausea, and diarrhea.

risks_warnings.title: Harm to fetus
risks_warnings.description: Acetazolamide has been shown to be cause birth defects. It should be used in pregnancy only if the potential benefit justifies the potential risk to the fetus.

description_processed.orig: Acetazolamide has been shown to be cause birth defects. It should be used in pregnancy only if the potential benefit justifies the potential risk to the fetus.

risks_warnings.title: Severe allergic reactions
risks_warnings.description: Severe reactions to drugs like Acetazolamide include skin reactions like Stevens-Johnson syndrome and toxic epidermal necrolysis, liver failure, and blood disorders. If signs of allergic reactions occur, stop using the drug immediately.

description_processed.orig: Severe reactions to drugs like Acetazolamide include skin reactions like Stevens-Johnson syndrome and toxic epidermal necrolysis, liver failure, and blood disorders. If signs of allergic reactions occur, stop using the drug immediately.

risks_warnings.title: Drug interactions
risks_warnings.description: Don't take high-dose aspirin with Acetazolamide since cases of anorexia, breathing problems, fatigue, and coma have been reported.

description_processed.orig: Don't take high-dose aspirin with Acetazolamide since cases of anorexia, breathing problems, fatigue, and coma have been reported.

carousel_items: The lowest possible dose of corticosteroids should be used to control your symptoms.
When reducing or stopping the dose, do it very slowly and follow your doctor's instructions exactly to prevent major health emergencies.
If you used Dexamethasone for a long time, you could get withdrawal symptoms like muscle pain, joint pain, and malaise.
Some people gain weight while taking Dexamethasone or can experience other side effects like mood changes.
Don't get live or live/attenuated vaccines while on this. Killed or inactivated vaccines are fine.

basics.benefits_moa: Dexamethasone is a short-acting corticosteroid. It lowers inflammation by preventing your capillaries (small blood vessels) from leaking out excess fluid and chemicals that cause swelling.
basics.bottom_line: Dexamethasone is identical to an essential hormone that humans produce and has been proven to work safely.
downsides: Can't be used on its own to treat low cortisol levels.
Since it suppresses your immune system, you're more likely to get infections.
You can't take Dexamethasone if you have a systemic fungal infection.
Shouldn't be used if you have a stomach ulcer.
Can decrease bone formation and lead to an increased risk of osteoporosis.

downsides_processed.orig: Can't be used on its own to treat low cortisol levels.
Since it suppresses your immune system, you're more likely to get infections.
You can't take Dexamethasone if you have a systemic fungal infection.
Shouldn't be used if you have a stomach ulcer.
Can decrease bone formation and lead to an increased risk of osteoporosis.

upsides: Treats a large variety of inflammatory disorders including asthma, dermatitis, drug reactions, rashes, and endocrine disorders.
Can help prevent nausea, especially when it's caused by chemotherapy.
You can get it orally or as an injection.

upsides_processed.orig: Treats a large variety of inflammatory disorders including asthma, dermatitis, drug reactions, rashes, and endocrine disorders.
Can help prevent nausea, especially when it's caused by chemotherapy.
You can get it orally or as an injection.

drugs.one_liner: Lowers inflammation and suppresses your immune system.
drugs.name: dexamethasone

off-label_indications.indication: Prevention of nausea and vomiting from chemotherapy

carousel_items_processed.orig: The lowest possible dose of corticosteroids should be used to control your symptoms.
When reducing or stopping the dose, do it very slowly and follow your doctor's instructions exactly to prevent major health emergencies.
If you used Dexamethasone for a long time, you could get withdrawal symptoms like muscle pain, joint pain, and malaise.
Some people gain weight while taking Dexamethasone or can experience other side effects like mood changes.
Don't get live or live/attenuated vaccines while on this. Killed or inactivated vaccines are fine.

risks_warnings.title: Adrenal suppression
risks_warnings.description: Adrenal suppression leading to adrenal crisis can occur if you lower your dose or stop taking Dexamethasone too quickly. Symptoms include joint or muscle pain, extreme low energy and depression. Changes in your Dexamethasone dose need to be done slowly over time. Talk to your doctor before you make any changes or stop the medication.
risk_factors: Lowering dose or stopping too quickly especially after long-term treatment
Stress such as trauma, surgery or infection

description_processed.orig: Adrenal suppression leading to adrenal crisis can occur if you lower your dose or stop taking Dexamethasone too quickly. Symptoms include joint or muscle pain, extreme low energy and depression. Changes in your Dexamethasone dose need to be done slowly over time. Talk to your doctor before you make any changes or stop the medication.

risks_warnings.title: Infections
risks_warnings.description: If you take Dexamethasone for a long time it can increase your risk of all types of infections, make it hard to tell if you have one, take longer to fight and be more serious. Be careful not to be in contact with anyone who has the chicken pox or measles. If you had tuberculosis (TB) in the past your doctor will need to monitor you while taking Dexamethasone. You may need to take medicine to prevent getting it or treat it if your TB comes back. Talk to your doctor before taking Dexamethasone if you haven't had vaccinations against certain viral diseases, are under stress or regularly around sick people.
risk_factors: Contact with people who have viral illness
History of bacterial or viral conditions

description_processed.orig: If you take Dexamethasone for a long time it can increase your risk of all types of infections, make it hard to tell if you have one, take longer to fight and be more serious. Be careful not to be in contact with anyone who has the chicken pox or measles. If you had tuberculosis (TB) in the past your doctor will need to monitor you while taking Dexamethasone. You may need to take medicine to prevent getting it or treat it if your TB comes back. Talk to your doctor before taking Dexamethasone if you haven't had vaccinations against certain viral diseases, are under stress or regularly around sick people.

risks_warnings.title: Kaposi's sarcoma
risks_warnings.description: It’s rare, but taking Dexamethasone for a long period of time, can increase your risk of Kaposi’s sarcoma, a type of cancer that can affect both the skin and internal organs. Your doctor will monitor you closely while you're taking Dexamethasone and if this develops, will work with you to slowly lower your dose and stop the medication.

description_processed.orig: It’s rare, but taking Dexamethasone for a long period of time, can increase your risk of Kaposi’s sarcoma, a type of cancer that can affect both the skin and internal organs. Your doctor will monitor you closely while you're taking Dexamethasone and if this develops, will work with you to slowly lower your dose and stop the medication.

risks_warnings.title: Mood and behavior changes
risks_warnings.description: Like most corticosteroid medicines, Dexamethasone may cause changes in your mood or behavior. Tell your doctor right away if you become depressed, have mood swings, trouble sleeping, irritability or anxiety, hyperactivity,  delusions or hallucinations while taking this medicine. If you need to make any changes or slowly taper your dose, talk to your doctor first.

description_processed.orig: Like most corticosteroid medicines, Dexamethasone may cause changes in your mood or behavior. Tell your doctor right away if you become depressed, have mood swings, trouble sleeping, irritability or anxiety, hyperactivity,  delusions or hallucinations while taking this medicine. If you need to make any changes or slowly taper your dose, talk to your doctor first.

risks_warnings.title: Bone effects
risks_warnings.description: Dexamethasone can thin the bones and decrease the growth rate in children. Talk to the doctor about medicine choices that won't negatively affect growth. Use the lowest possible dose to treat the condition and have the doctor monitor your child’s height during treatment.

description_processed.orig: Dexamethasone can thin the bones and decrease the growth rate in children. Talk to the doctor about medicine choices that won't negatively affect growth. Use the lowest possible dose to treat the condition and have the doctor monitor your child’s height during treatment.

risks_warnings.title: Harm to fetus
risks_warnings.description: Taking Dexamethasone if you're pregnant or breast-feeding can harm your unborn baby. If you need to take a systemic corticosteroid during pregnancy, the lowest dose that will help treat your condition should be used for the shortest time, especially during your first trimester. Your doctor will let you know if there are other medicine choices that are safer (e.g. inhaled steroids for asthma).

description_processed.orig: Taking Dexamethasone if you're pregnant or breast-feeding can harm your unborn baby. If you need to take a systemic corticosteroid during pregnancy, the lowest dose that will help treat your condition should be used for the shortest time, especially during your first trimester. Your doctor will let you know if there are other medicine choices that are safer (e.g. inhaled steroids for asthma).
